references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
Kruchinin Vladimir Victorovich, Composition of ordinary generating functions, arXiv:1009.2565
formula: a(n) = sum((-1)^(k+1)evenp(n+k), k=1,n, (-1)^((n+k)/2)/k*sum(j=k,n, j!/n!*stirling2(n,j)*2^(n-j)*(-1)^(n+j-k)*binomial(j-1,k-1)), n>0 [_Vladimir Kruchinin_, Aug 18 2010]a(n) = sum(m=0..(n-1)/2, sum(j=0..2*m, binomial(j+n-2*m-1,n-2*m-1)*(j+n-2*m)!*2^(2*m-j)*(-1)^(n-m+j-1)*stirling2(n,j+n-2*m))/(n-2*m)); [_Vladimir Kruchinin_, Jan 21 2012]a(n) ~ (-1)^(n+1) * 4^n * (n-1)! / Pi^n. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 16 2015
mathematica: With[{nn = 30}, CoefficientList[Series[Log[1 + Tan[x]], {x, 0, nn}], x] Range[0, nn]!] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Apr 11 2014 *)
prog: (Maxima) a(n):=sum((-1)^(k+1)*if evenp(n+k) then (-1)^((n+k)/2)/k*sum(j!/n!*stirling2(n,j)*2^(n-j)*(-1)^(n+j-k)*binomial(j-1,k-1),j,k,n) else 0,k,1,n);  /* _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Aug 18 2010 */(Maxima) a(n):=sum(sum(binomial(j+n-2*m-1,n-2*m-1)*(j+n-2*m)!*2^(2*m-j)*(-1)^(n-m+j-1)*stirling2(n,j+n-2*m),j,0,2*m)/(n-2*m),m,0,(n-1)/2); /* _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Jan 21 2012 */(PARI) x='x+O('x^66); concat([0],Vec(serlaplace(log(1+tan(x))))) \\ _Joerg Arndt_, Sep 02 2013
author: _R. H. Hardin_, _Simon Plouffe_
extensions: Name corrected, more terms, _Joerg Arndt_, Sep 02 2013
